RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino
United States Border Patrol Agent Ignacio Rodriguez Jr.

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: conducted a vehicle stop and was involved in the arrest of Defendants RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: highway where vehicles were inspected by United States Border Patrol and location of Freer immigration checkpoint; location of the traffic stop; part of route used to avoid checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint: location where Agent Trevino was stationed and conducted inspections; checkpoint avoided by smugglers; location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was transported for further questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint Building: building where Agent Trevino processed undocumented individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol Station Parking Lot: parking lot adjacent to the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: approached the white Malibu sedan and presumed it was riding low because there were five people in it; testified that he could drive Farm-to-Market Road 2050 at eighty miles per hour despite its narrowness and sharp turns; was stationed at the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Ignaci: called out vehicles going southbound during Agent Trevino's shift, driver of the black Dodge pickup truck, was nervous during a traffic stop by Officer Reyes; provided inconsistent information about vehicle ownership
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot where vehicles turned southbound and where drop-offs of undocumented individuals were noticed; used by smugglers to avoid checkpoints; primarily used by ranchers, oil trucks, and occasional small cars from a nearby wind farm; has intersections with Mills Bennett Road, San Pablo Road, and Santo Nino Road; location of the traffic stop; known to be a popular smuggling route; described as having no shoulder and being 'real narrow' with 'sharp turns'
